children.text: This area has not been constructed the same as it is displayed at the display home, and there is no mention on the contract documents that the owner should expect anything different to display.
The builder’s display home for this house design shows how it should be done, and what the owner can expect when purchasing this house design.
Division 6, section 43.3 of the Domestic Building Contracts Act 1995 states that

‘If a display home is made available for inspection by or on behalf of a builder, and a building owner enters into a contract with the builder for the construction of a similar home, the builder must construct the home using the same plans and specifications and to at least the same standards of work quality and quality of materials as were used for the construction of the display home’
. It also states that the penalty for non-compliance is 50 penalty units, which is approximately $8,261.
The builder should reconstruct this area to ensure this home presents the same as the display home.
